intro: Falcaria sioides, commonly known as the creeping sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. Its flowers are typically white or pink, with five petals, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Falcaria sioides is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low water availability.
